items.title: Ukraine launches 221 drones on Russia, Moscow says
items.summary: The overnight attack is the largest since May, but follows much larger bombardments from Russia.

items.title: South Korean workers detained in US raid arrive home
items.summary: Media and some protesters gather at the airport as more than 300 workers detained in the US last week return.

items.title: 'Looks like a toy, but it's real': BBC examines a downed Russian drone
items.summary: Drones like this one were shot down over Polish airspace in the early hours of Wednesday.

items.title: Worried migrants head home from India after Nepal turmoil
items.summary: Nepalis rush home from India as deadly protests have engulfed the Himalayan nation.

items.title: Nato strengthens defences after Russian drones shot down over Poland
items.summary: Germany, the Netherlands and the Czech Republic will be sending Poland more support to defend Nato's eastern flank.

items.title: Israeli strikes in Yemen kill 35 people, Houthis say
items.summary: The Israeli military says it hit military targets, but the Houthis say only civilian sites were targeted.

items.title: Putin and Netanyahu present twin challenges to Trump's diplomacy
items.summary: Israel's strikes in Doha and the Russian drone incursion could present major affronts to his authority.

items.title: Accidental or deliberate? Russia's drone incursion into Poland is a test for Nato
items.summary: Whether the drone incursion was deliberate or accidental, Moscow will be watching Nato's response to it closely.
